As an AI language model, I don't have personal preferences, but I can certainly provide you with some major considerations that you should keep in mind while planning a destination wedding. Here are a few things to consider:

1. Laws and regulations: Different countries or states have different laws and regulations when it comes to getting married, make sure to research the legal requirements for your destination wedding.

2. Budget: Destination weddings can be more expensive than a typical wedding, as you have to consider travel and accommodation costs for you and your guests.

3. Culture and customs: Make sure to research the local customs and traditions of your chosen destination to avoid any cultural misunderstandings or faux pas.

4. Weather and season: You need to choose a time of year when the weather is favorable for your destination wedding. You don't want your big day to be ruined by bad weather conditions.

5. Guests: Remember, not all of your guests may be able to travel to your chosen destination. Be sure to give them plenty of advance notice so they can plan accordingly.

6. Vendor availability: Depending on your destination, there may be a limited number of vendors for you to choose from. Make sure to research and book vendors as early as possible to avoid disappointment.

7. Destination logistics: Consider the logistics of your destination wedding, like transportation, accommodation, and the availability of local services.

These are just some things to think about when planning a destination wedding. It may be helpful to enlist the help of a wedding planner who specializes in destination weddings to ensure that everything runs smoothly.
